article_title: Becton Dickinson to Buy CareFusion for $12.2 Billion
article_text:
Becton, Dickinson & Co. agreed to buy CareFusion Corp. in a $12.2 billion deal designed to provide a full range of medical products to hospitals, which are under pressure to cut costs and improve quality.

Becton, based in Franklin Lakes, N.J., will pay $58 in cash and stock for each share of San Diego-based CareFusion, based on Becton’s closing share price Friday. CareFusion shares rose 1.8% to $46.17 in New York Stock Exchange...

twitter.description: Becton, Dickinson & Co. agreed to buy CareFusion Corp. for $12.2 billion in a combination designed to provide a full range of products for hospital systems, according to people familiar with the matter.
twitter.title: Becton Dickinson to Buy CareFusion for $12.2 Billion

article_summary:
CareFusion shares rose 1.8% to $46.17 in New York Stock Exchange...
Becton, Dickinson & Co. agreed to buy CareFusion Corp. in a $12.2 billion deal designed to provide a full range of medical products to hospitals, which are under pressure to cut costs and improve quality.
Becton, based in Franklin Lakes, N.J., will pay $58 in cash and stock for each share of San Diego-based CareFusion, based on Becton’s closing share price Friday.
